entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 8:03AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WATER LEVELS FALLING ACROSS MATSU RIVERS AND STREAMS TODAY... Matanuska-Susitna Borough area rivers and streams have generally crested overnight or are near their crest this morning as of 7AM. High river levels will fall today with no additional rises expected in the short-term. For those continuing to recreate today, please take care to use

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warm Temperatures through Sunday... Highest temperatures are expected today and possibly Saturday with temperatures warming into the upper 60s along the northern and central gulf coast and into the low 70s along the southern Gulf coast. entry.summary: ...Warm Temperatures through Sunday... entry.summary: ...Elevated Heat Index Values This Afternoon... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 3:35AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES UP TO 110 DEGREES THIS AFTERNOON... The combination of near average temperatures, elevated dew points and high relative humidity will produce Heat Index values up to 110 degrees this afternoon. A few locations across portions of Kenedy and the Lower, Mid and Upper Rio Grande Valley may briefly experience Heat Index values of 111 to 113 degrees.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 3:21AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat. Young children and pets should never be left
